Class com.google.common.io.CharStreams

Removed Methods
CharSink asCharSink(OutputSupplier<? extends Appendable>) Returns a view of the given {@code Appendable} supplier as a {@code CharSink}.
CharSource asCharSource(InputSupplier<? extends Readable>) Returns a view of the given {@code Readable} supplier as a {@code CharSource}.
long copy(InputSupplier<R>, OutputSupplier<W>) Opens Readable and Appendable objects from the given factories, copies all characters between the two, and closes them.
long copy(InputSupplier<R>, Appendable) Opens a Readable object from the supplier, copies all characters to the Appendable object, and closes the input.
InputSupplier<Reader> join(InputSupplier[]) Varargs form of .join(Iterable).
InputSupplier<Reader> join(Iterable<? extends InputSupplier<? extends Reader>>) Joins multiple Reader suppliers into a single supplier.
InputSupplier<InputStreamReader> newReaderSupplier(InputSupplier<?, extends, InputStream>, Charset) Returns a factory that will supply instances of InputStreamReader, using the given InputStream factory and character set.
InputSupplier<StringReader> newReaderSupplier(String) Returns a factory that will supply instances of StringReader that read a string value.
OutputSupplier<OutputStreamWriter> newWriterSupplier(OutputSupplier<?, extends, OutputStream>, Charset) Returns a factory that will supply instances of OutputStreamWriter, using the given OutputStream factory and character set.
String readFirstLine(InputSupplier<R>) Reads the first line from a Readable & Closeable object supplied by a factory.
T readLines(InputSupplier<R>, LineProcessor<T>) Streams lines from a Readable and Closeable object supplied by a factory, stopping when our callback returns false, or we have read all of the lines.
List<String> readLines(InputSupplier<R>) Reads all of the lines from a Readable & Closeable object supplied by a factory.
String toString(InputSupplier<R>) Returns the characters from a Readable & Closeable object supplied by a factory as a String.
void write(CharSequence, OutputSupplier<W>) Writes a character sequence (such as a string) to an appendable object from the given supplier.
